website_summaries.verdict: The Sony STR-DN1040 is a truly first-class AV receiver, boasting tons of wireless technology and a pretty user interface, at a premium price.
pros: The Sony STR-DN1040 is the most feature-packed AV receiver you'll find at this price
There's built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and AirPlay, plus eight HDMI inputs, which is more than any of its competitors
It also sports a truly modern user interface with crisp, high-definition graphics
And the sound quality is fittingly excellent for a premium AV receiver
cons: It's somewhat expensive and more than what most buyers need
The included remote is cluttered with buttons, sure to put-off nontechies
And Sony's automatic speaker calibration wasn't quite perfect in our listening environment

customer_reviews.title: GUI is dead after 5 years effectively killing the receiver
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product for the first 5 years but as of today it is no longer functional. Seems planned obsolescence is a thing. The graphical user interface no longer appears and now intermittently the screen goes blank. I have tried everything to fix the issue including resetting the receiver to factory. I have not seen this issue on the internet. I used to buy Sony all the time and gave this one a try. Think I will bypass them in the future, you may want to do the same if you want your purchase to last longer than 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Longevity and Quality with Sony
customer_reviews.text: I liked this receiver when it worked, but just after 4 years, the onscreen menus are garbled and this won't be an inexpensive repair. Factory resets and power cycling doesn't help. If there was a way to re-flash the firmware, that might help, but it isn't possible with Sony. Unfortunately, I am outside of the Square Trade and manufacturer's warranty period. My other gear from Yamaha lasted a whole lot longer (is still usable) compared with Sony's short shelf life in my case. Looks like my next purchase will not be a Sony.

Set itself up in minutes with included microphone. I've not messed with the speaker levels since, sounds great. I shift through the modes quickly using the remote control depending on content type. customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit. It's a little hard getting all of the speakers to hook up but I could be doing something wrong. All in all it does everything it says it will do and looks good on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: justin wurtzler

customer_reviews.title: Can I return it?
customer_reviews.text: I swear they have made this so complicated. I like it when it works. If I put it on Satellite it plays really well. Turn it to BD and it says no signal. I then took the cable and plugged it directly into the TV and it worked. Over and over I cannot get BD in this stupid thing. I was going to buy a different brand and I should have.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this AVR up and running since March 7th and so far not one single issue. Setup was pretty straight forward but I have done a lot of tweaking of the settings and the effort keeps making it better. Connected components are a SONY BDP-S790 , SONY 55NX720 LED, and DIRECTV HD/DVR....and all absent of handshake issues but I will attribute that mostly to all SONY components. KLIPSCH 5.1 speaker setup is used so very little effort powering them. Video performance is also very good but I wish it would upscale to 1080p. I tried SONY's STR-DN1030 ( returned it ) when it was released and this 1040 is a step WAYYY in the right direction!
customer_reviews.author: Hueyhubert

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and Connectivity, yet disappointing remote and wifi control
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded form an Onkyo TX-806 receiver. Sound quality far superior and wifi, airplay and bluetooth connectivity live up ot what Sony represented. However the remote control, is a throw back to the 80's and Sony's on-screen AV control app is minimally functional. However a 3rd party android app: "MY AV" is sensational. It is th equivalent to a Logitech 900 remote (which is not supported for this receiver) at a fraction $9.00 of the cost. Would recommend the combination as a superb selection and value.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Handshake issues...
customer_reviews.text: Works well...when it works. Took a gamble and ended up with the dreaded HDMI handshake issues, even after updating firmware. Not satisfied with the "restart the system" recommendations by Sony to get it to work. Ended up returning the unit (within the 30d window) and going with a Yamaha unit instead.
customer_reviews.author: DLuce76

customer_reviews.title: The unit does not transmit audio over the HDMI to the second zone.
customer_reviews.text: I have a TV for the second zone. The unit does not transmit audio over the HDMI to the second zone or the primary zone for that matter. I have a stereo in the main room and it works great. But, going to the second room, NO sound. That's no good.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mays

customer_reviews.title: And the pass through when it's shut off is a great feature.
customer_reviews.text: Loving this thing. No issues so far. And the pass through when it's shut off is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tkalcich

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: just had to update the firmware but it works great
customer_reviews.author: Home Roasters

customer_reviews.title: It works perfect, some settings are over my head but I ...
customer_reviews.text: It works perfect, some settings are over my head but I got everything working and it sounds very nice
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the receiver for a while now and figured that since I haven't found anything I don't like about it....I should give it 5 stars. Some of the features I like the most: 1) I like that I can watch cable with the stereo off (pass-through) 2) I like that I can use my iPhone as a remote 3) Love the bluetooth and AirPlay 4) Sounds great There are many other things, but these are the most notable for my use. My previous receiver was also a Sony (ES Line). It has migrated to my bedroom and I find myself getting frustrated that it doesn't have many of the same features.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, all work as it should.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned over the negative reviews when I purchased this unit. It’s been over a month, and all is OK at this point. I was able to use the auto config to get the 5.1 setup in 10 min. My unit sits between DirecTV and the 65” monitor (with bad audio), it now has a great audio with everything I watch. So far, I have to use the SONY remote to power up this unit, and use the DirecTV remote to do everything else. I’m sure it’s about selecting the correct code. I’ll get to correcting this one day.
customer_reviews.author: Chin Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this system to replace my aging Onkyo receiver. I kept my old speaker but was quite surprised at the new deep crisp sound I am getting with my new Sony STR-DN1040. The built in WIFI is so handy, I am able to stream music right from my HD . Great system. I would recommend i any day.
customer_reviews.author: simm

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job, Good Quality Video & Audio
customer_reviews.text: When switching from one input source to another there is no auto detect. You have to manually switch. Not major since the source is easy to select. However what is major is that you also have to change the audio output source. This is annoying and ridiculous. Output is speakers. When you switch inputs, the default audio output should still be the speakers. Set up was easy and seemed to produce good results. The cable for the calibration microphone was about 6 feet too short for my room (18 feet from the equipment to the seating area). It should be fine for most listening/viewing rooms where it is 12 feet or less from the equipment to the seating area.
customer_reviews.author: als

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very overstated power. Go bigger! I'll move this to the laundry room soon enough
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Smith

customer_reviews.title: A very high quality receiver system
customer_reviews.text: All money worth spent. Connects to AirPlay instantly, Bluetooth works great. And the sound quality is also great. Remote is easy to use, many hdmi ports work as a charm. I am yet to discover any recommendations for improvement for this receiver. Have had it for a couple if months now.
customer_reviews.author: Mandeep S. Pahuja

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, good power and does what it was designed to do! Very happy with the product
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever owned...
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself fussy when it comes to home audio. This is, without question, the best A/V receiver I have ever owned (and I've had quite a few). Flat line right out of the box, will blow you away. Bluetooth and WiFi are technology features that make this receiver even more versatile. Extremely satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: trandazz7

customer_reviews.title: Simply very disappointed overall with value and especially with customer "support"
customer_reviews.text: Simply very disappointed overall with value and especially with customer "support". I am sick to death of support being outsourced. I'd elaborate on value but i am so disintested that all i can say is CNET why the raves?
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Uhl

customer_reviews.title: Good but missing a vital feature for some.
customer_reviews.text: This is a feature rich, very nice receiver. It can accommodate two zones. However, you cannot operate both zones with two different sources simultaneously. For us, this is a deal breaker. We have a home entertainment system in our living room and outdoor speakers around our deck. Unfortunately, you cannot operate both at the same time with different sources (e.g. cable TV inside and radio station outside). It's one or the other, or both utilizing the same source at the same time. Denon receiver's accommodate this capability but not this Sony. If you don't need that feature, you won't find a better quality, feature rich, easy to use receiver available from any manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: JEB

customer_reviews.title: Really good reciever
customer_reviews.text: I love this new reciever it really it's just what I want it
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Good Receiver
customer_reviews.text: The receiver sounds great and was easy to setup. Works great with my TV, a PS3, DVD Player and a Google Chromecast. Would have been five stars but for two issues: 1) Updating the receiver takes an hour or two. The online prompts don't warn you of this when you are installing and it doesn't give you feedback that it is installing. 2) Every so often, I have to unplug the receiver. The symptoms I get are that it scrambles the HDMI signal out of the receiver and it indicates it has no sound signal.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, simple install, AirPlay too!!
customer_reviews.text: Very quick clean install. Many less cables due to HDMI for everything. Great sound, the onscreen UI makes it very easy to setup. Love the ability to AirPlay from my Apple devices. Completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PB in Jersey

product_meta.title: Sony STR-DN1040 7.2-Channel Network A/V Receiver (Built-in Wi-fi & Bluetooth)
product_meta.description:
Stream crisp, powerful audio with built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and Airplay. With 7.2 channels and 150 watts8 of power, it’s legendary Sony sound that really connects. Featuring 4K resolution pass-through, 6 HD inputs and a graphical interface, this receiver brings out the best in your music, Blu-ray movies, games and more.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER










Enjoy superior sound while easily steaming music with built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and AirPlay. With 7.2 channels and 165 watts8 of power, driven by the largest capacitors and transformer in its class, its legendary Sony sound that really connects. Featuring 4K resolution pass-through and upscaling, 10 HD inputs and a redesigned menu system with easy setup wizard, this receiver is the ultimate high resolution sound stage for your music, Blu-ray movies, games and more. Technology 7.2 Ch. Of Power 165W per channel, this powerhouse envelopes you in a new level of sound performance. (165W x 7 @ 8ohms 1kHz 0.9% THD with 1 ch. driven) Wi-Fi Built-in Get connected to the Internet and your home network to access more music than you can imagine, including music stored on your computer, music services built-in or AirPlay. Bluetooth Built-in Play your music out loud – stream it from your smart phone or tablet to the receiver. Bluetooth streaming can even wake the receiver from standby mode. AirPlay Easily stream your music from your iPhone/iPod Touch, iPad or iTunes along with compatible music Apps like Spotify and iHeart Radio. Simply touch the AirPlay logo when it appears and select the STR-DN1040 to amplify your tunes. AirPlay can even wake your receiver from standby mode. Network Services Music streaming at its very best. Navigate and enjoy the latest from Pandora, Music Unlimited, Slacker and vTuner. 10 HD Inputs Get versatile HD connection options with 10 HD inputs. Eight HDMI inputs (up to 4K capable) let you connect a Sony PlayStation3 entertainment system, Blu-ray Disc player, any 6 other HDMI-capable devices, for high definition video and audio6. Two component inputs (1080/60i capable) provide added HD-capable connectivity and versatility. 
Additional Features Explore the full range of features and options below. 
New Advanced on-screen display user interface
Set-up and control the A/V receiver with a redesigned intuitive on-screen display user interface. Change inputs, adjust settings and confirm volume levels on-screen.

Easy set-up wizard
Easily set-up the DN1040 with an easy to follow on-screen wizard. Get connected to the Internet, set up your speakers and get ready for action.

Sound Optimizer
No longer do you have to miss out movies dynamic sound effects when you need to keep the volume low, the sound optimizer enables you to hear the smallest sound effect at low volumes. This dynamic feature gives you the best reproduction of sound effects while keeping the intended sound stage at high or low volume levels.

Up convert/Upscales Video signal to 4K via HDMI
Improve image quality non-4K connected devices to near HD3. Analog connected device signals are converted to digital and output via HDMI, making one cable connection from the receiver to the HDMI-enabled TV possible.

HD Digital Cinema Sound and Front High Speakers
Optimize your receiver to mimic the sound characteristics of movie theaters. Front Height mode enables vocal height and 3D effects for better positioning of effects giving added depth to visuals and concerts. Imagine as a helicopter comes from above and lands – you’ll hear the change in height as the effect unfolds on-screen.



Control with your iPhone or Android devices with free Apps
Download the free Media Remote and Network Audio Remote apps from the iTunes or Google play app stores and use your iPhone or Android devices to control volume, inputs and receiver function with the Media Remote and control your network music with the Network Audio Remote.

iPod/iPhone Music and Video playback via USB5
Listen to music and watch video stored on your iPod or iPhone while charging your device through the receivers front USB input5.

3D Pass-through
Compatible with Blu-ray 3D movies, video games and other 3D content1.

Advanced Blu-ray Disc Audio Decoding
Experience sound closer to the way it was captured with LPCM, Dolby trueHD, ProLogic IIz and dts-HD master audio codecs2.

Advanced Digital Cinema Auto Calibration - Quick Speaker Set Up
Ensure you get the best sound experience from your A/V receiver and speakers. This advanced version offers auto phase matching. Simply place the included microphone where you will be seated and settings are automatically optimized based on the distance, delays and placement of your speakers.



Audio Return Channel
Eliminate the need for extra cables connected to your TV. This feature allows audio to be sent from your compatible TV to your receiver through the same HDMI cable already being used to send audio and video to your TV7. 

Standby pass-through of
Audio & Video
Conveniently access all your HDMI connected devices without having to power on the receiver.

Assignable digital audio
and video inputs
Get the most out of each audio and video input with the ability to reassign inputs to support connected devices.

BRAVIA Sync Capable (HDMI CEC)
Conveniently operate and control select Sony BRAVIA Sync devices with one remote including: Sony Blu-ray Disc Players, BRAVIA HDTVs, Sony home theater products4. 

24p True Cinema (pass-through)
Watch Blu-ray Disc movies in their native frame rate (24 frames per second) when paired with a 24p HDTV and playback device like a Blu-ray Disc Player or PlayStation3 gaming console via HDMI cable6.




1. Requires 3D content, 3D HDTV, 3D glasses and HDMI cable (at least 10.2 Gbps).

2. Requires HDMI cable and LPCM capable receiver.

3. Requires HDTV with equivalent display and HDMI cable sold separately.

4. Syncs with BRAVIA Sync or Theatre Sync products.

5. iPod support is limited to the following players: iPod touch, iPod classic, iPod nano 1st, 2nd & 3rd generation, iPod 4th& 5th generation & iPod mini and iPhone 3G, 3Gs and 4G models.

6. Requires HDMI cable sold separately.

7. Requires HDTV and HDMI cable sold separately.
